title: How to Remove a Sliding Screen Door

steps.title: Remove any curtains or other decorations.
steps.content: Remove any curtains or other decorations. Any decorative items you may have on the door, such as curtains, will only get in the way of your job. Removing them before you start working will save you from hassle later on. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the screws at the bottom of the door.
steps.content: Locate the screws at the bottom of the door. Most sliding screen doors have screws located at the bottom corners. These screws hold the wheels your door uses to slide back and forth on its track in place. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use a Phillips head screwdriver to unscrew each screw.
steps.content: Use a Phillips head screwdriver to unscrew each screw. Unscrewing the bottom screws will effectively loosen the door’s wheels and make the door easier to remove from its frame. Be sure to rotate the screwdriver to the left to unscrew the screws. Don’t stop until you can clearly see the heads of both screws sticking out of their sockets, and the door has become loose enough for you to push it up and away from the bottom track. [3] X Research source You don’t have to take the screws out completely unless there’s no other way to get the door off the track. You can test this by lifting the door once the screw heads are poking out of their sockets. If the door lifts up from the track easily, don’t unscrew any further. Keep unscrewing if the door won’t lift.

steps.title: Pull the door up until you can see its bottom wheels.
steps.content: Pull the door up until you can see its bottom wheels. [4] X Expert Source Patrick Johns Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. You should be able to see 1 wheel on either side of the door. When you pull the door up, move it as gently as you can. You don’t want to risk breaking the door or any of its parts, especially if you plan on putting the door back later on. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Unscrew the head stop with a power or Phillips screwdriver.
steps.content: Unscrew the head stop with a power or Phillips screwdriver. Open the door and locate the head stop screw at the top corner of the door frame, right where the door would touch the frame when it closes. This screw may be tightly fixed; if you can’t undo it with a manual screwdriver, try a power screwdriver. [6] X Research source Your screen door could fall out of the frame once the door stop is taken out. Be sure to have someone else watching it while you work until you’re ready to take the door out of the frame. They can catch the door just in case it falls. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Slip a flat screwdriver underneath the wheels and push them upwards.
steps.content: Slip a flat screwdriver underneath the wheels and push them upwards. [8] X Expert Source Patrick Johns Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. Pushing the wheels up will make it easier to lift the door out of the track. Again, move the screwdriver gently. It should slide underneath the wheels with only a little bit of effort. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the door up from the bottom track until the wheels are out.
steps.content: Pull the door up from the bottom track until the wheels are out. [10] X Expert Source Patrick Johns Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. You will be able to tell the wheels are sufficiently loosened once you’re able to pull the door up away from the bottom track. Pull it gently, and keep holding it up to begin moving the door out of the frame. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the door over the bottom track and out toward you.
steps.content: Slide the door over the bottom track and out toward you. [12] X Expert Source Patrick Johns Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. You will have to pull the door upwards first before you can maneuver it out of the track. Again, move as gently as you can. It will not take much force to remove the door now that the wheels are loosened. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the door by pulling it out of the top track of the door frame.
steps.content: Remove the door by pulling it out of the top track of the door frame. [14] X Expert Source Patrick Johns Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. The door should slide right out of the top track once you’ve freed it from the bottom track. Once the door is completely loose from the frame, set it aside somewhere safe, such as against the side of the house or lying flat on a work bench. [15] X Research source
